description: When their father unveils his newest invention, the Power Pack unexpectedly find themselves facing off against one of their most shocking opponents ever! Lucky for them, the Hulk is there to lead their charge into action! Get ready for more gamma goodness!
name: Energy Crisis

description:
The Mummy (Batman and Robin in a Hostess Twinkee Ad)

Riddler on the Move! (Batman vs Riddler, with Alfred : reprinted in: Best of DC #14)

The Riddler begins taking over another crooks’ employment agency for criminals, and traps Batman within an array of loaded crossbows.
name: Riddler on the Move!

description: Kade's quest for revenge against Apollyon begins here.
name: Pursuit

description: Lost in the dreaded Superstition Mountains of Arizona, without weapons, Lara Croft faces three powerful foes.....the desert, her nemesis, Lady Jasmine and her band of cutthroats, and the man Lara came to the dance with.....Joe Notafraid, who's been possessed by the vengeful Thunder God protecting the fabled Lost Dutchman's Gold Mine.
name: The Black Legion, Part 3

description:
Night of Terror (7 pages)

Beachhead on Saturn's Ring (7 pages)

Astronomical Oddities (1 page)

Meteors -- Terrible Missiles from Space (2 pages)

Fun in the Future (1 page)

Prison Planet (7 pages)

Venus or Bust (5 pages)
name: Beachhead on Saturn's Ring; Night of Terror

volume.name: Adventures Of The Little Green Dinosaur

description:
The Deadly Trio with Dr. Solar 
 
One page text page "Solars Science Forum" which is really a letters page 
 
Professor Harbinger:  "Cateriller Cutups" 4 pages
 
5 pages of "The Gold Key Club" with pictures of animals and airplanes sent in by readers and a page of joke, short cartoons and Dinosauria about the Iguanodon. 

Last 12¢ Issue (nearly - see next issue) .
name: King Cybernoid Strikes

volume.name: Doctor Solar, Man of the Atom

description:
Professor Harbinger:  "Caterpillar Cutups"

First 15¢ Issue,   
Variant:  12¢ on cover (see pic below).
name: The Deadly Trio

volume.name: Doctor Solar, Man of the Atom

description:
Part I of a two issue storyline.

Professor Harbinger:  "The Breathless World"
name: The Lost Dimension, Part 1

volume.name: Doctor Solar, Man of the Atom

description:
Cerebus kicks an old man off the roof to teach the crowd something. He later catches a cold. Later, he punches Boobah and Mrs Gutch beats him up when he's in bed. Weisshaupt demands all of Cerebus' gold.

Also includes part 1 of "The Jade Princess," a Dick Mallet adventure
name: Another Thing Coming

description:
After receiving an anonymous tip (strongly implied to be from Kenneth Irons), Sara and Jake discover the body of Setsuke who was recently murdered by Ian Nottingham by order of Irons. Meanwhile, assassins sent by Setsuke's Yakuza family attempt to take revenge on Nottingham.

Takes place not long after the events of Witchblade #31

1. Teacher's Pet Peeve (Bugs Bunny, Pete Puma, Clyde Rabbit)
 
2. What I Did on My Vacation Part 1 (Ralph Phillips) 
 
3. School Dazed (Sylvester, Sylvester Junior)
 
4. Batman Activity Book (activity pages) 
 
5. What I Did on My Vacation Part 2 (Ralph Phillips) 
    
6. Homework Helper (Foghorn Leghorn, Miss Prissy, Egghead Junior)
 
7. What I Did on My Vacation Part 3 (Ralph Phillips)
name: Teacher's Pet Peeve

description:
1. Comic Book Guy Gets a Life! (written by Ian Boothby : reprinted from Simpsons #105)

Comic Book Guy gets a brain injury and actually becomes "normal." Is that better?

  1. The Origin Of Glowy: The Radioactive Dog (reprinted from Radioactive Man 80 pg. Colossal #1)

  2. Backstage At Bongo Comics Group

  3. Holy Cow!! Has Pie Man Turned Evil? (written by Ty Templeton : reprinted from Simpsons Super Spectacular #1)

Pieman has an evil doppleganger! Who is he?

  1. Heroes For Rent (Or Lease To Own) (reprinted from Simpsons #100)

Lenny and Carl become Nuclear Power Man and Iron Foot to defeat Disco Inferno (Disco Stu)!
name: Free-For-All!

description:
1. "The Secret of the Captive Cavemen" (Superman, Batman and Robin) written by Bill Finger, penciled and inked by Jim Mooney. The trio chase an alien and travel back in time to prehistory. Reprinted in World's Finest Comics #206 and Showcase Presents: World's Finest #2.
  2. "Little Pete" gag strip by Henry Boltinoff.
  3. "Build Your Own Universe" one page full text story written by Unknown.
  4. "The Secret Face of Funny-Arrow!" (Green Arrow & Speedy) written by Ed Herron, penciled and inked by Lee Elias. Reprinted in Showcase Presents: Green Arrow #1.
  5. "Peter Puptent Explorer" gag strip by Henry Boltinoff.

Notes:

  • Superman, Batman and Robin travel 50,000 years into the past.
  • Squirt Gun Arrow, combined Rope-Boomerang and Balloon Arrow, Messenger-Pigeon Arrow, Jack-in-the-Box Arrow, Vacuum Arrow and Balloon Arrow used by the villain Funny Arrow.
  • Boxing Glove Arrow used by Green Arrow.
name: Secret of the Captured Cavemen / The Secret Face of Funny-Arrow!

description: A solitary figure, clad in the distinctive armor of a Mandalorian Warrior, cuts through a throng of soldiers, bounty hunters, and cutthroats, unleashing a barrage of blaster fire with graceful, cold-blooded dexterity. This could only be the most notorious assassin in the galaxy: Jango Fett! This Christmas, Dark Horse Comics is giving you something you've always wanted, a glimpse of Boba Fett, the most mysterious and beloved of all the Star Wars rogues. First you'll meet Jango Fett, a bounty hunter and killer for hire who is looking for a lucrative job. When Jango is hired to recover a rare and extremely valuable artifact, he thinks this could be his biggest score. Only one obstacle stands between him and his prize: a beautiful and deadly rival!

1. Cover by Bob Oskner.
  2. "The Ten Deadly Visions of the 100" written by Cary Bates, penciled by John Rosenberger and inked by Vince Colletta. (Lois Lane, Superman, The 100, Perry White, Julie Spence, Marsha Mallow, Kristin Cutler) Lois and Superman learn they only defeated the Mobster division of the 100. Next they go up against the Space Raiders, the space division of the 100.
  3. "The Richest Girl in the World!" written by Robert Kanigher, penciled and inked by Don Heck. (Rose and Thorn)

  4. "Nine Lives has the Catwoman!" "A DC Extra" Reprinted from Batman #35.
name: The Ten Deadly Visions of the 100 / The Richest Girl in the World! / Nine Lives has the Catwoman!

description:
1. "Be Sure of Your Facts!" public service message by Buzzy / written by Jack Schiff.
  2. "Superboy's Voyage to New Krypton"
  3. (Part 1) "The Return of Jor-El and Lara!" Jor-El and Lara mysteriously show up when Superboy succumbs to Kryptonite sickness...
  4. "Tricksy the World's Greatest Stuntman" gag strip by Henry Boltinoff.
  5. (Part 2) "The Voyage to New Krypton!" The newly reunited family are going to leave Earth for New Krypton...
  6. "Peg" gag strip by Henry Boltinoff.
  7. "Private Pete" gag strip by Henry Boltinoff.
  8. (Part 3) "The Orphan of Steel!" Superboy's new family arrives on their new planet, but have no super-powers. What can they do when a moon starts falling towards New Krypton?
  9. "Annie Gram" puzzle and activity page.

Notes:

  • Reprinted in Superboy Annual #1.
name: Superboy's Voyage to New Krypton

description:
1. Free Speech -- Free for All! (public service message from Buzzy / written by Jack Schiff)

  2. "Jimmy Olsen, Orphan!" (Jimmy Olsen, Superman, Supergirl, Perry White)

Jimmy gets amnesia in Midvale and is placed in an orphanage. Can Linda Lee (Supergirl) prevent Jimmy from being adopted and not blow her secret identity?

  1. Ollie (gag strip by Henry Boltinoff)

  2. The Irresistible Jimmy Olsen! (Jimmy Olsen, Superman, Lois Lane, Lucy Lane / written by Robert Bernstein)

Jimmy stays at a hotel, and is mistaken for a talent scout. So naturally, actresses flock around him. What will Lucy Lane think of all this?

  1. Peg (gag strip by Henry Boltinoff)

  2. Elastic Lad's Greatest Feats! (Jimmy Olsen as Elastic Lad, Superman, Jimmy Olsen Fan Club) / written by Otto Binder)

Jimmy quaffs the Elastic lad formula for his fans and to bust up a criminal organization. But the formula wears off at the worst time! Can Superman or his fan club rescue him?
name: Jimmy Olsen, Orphan!
Oswald the Rabbit and the Prehistoric Egg

description:
1. In the Realm of the Subconscious

  2. The Return of Ibac

  3. Death Rides the Skies (full text story)

  4. Nippo From Nagasaki

  5. Charles Martel, the Hammering Frank (Famous Blitzkriegs of the Past)

  6. Captain Marvel Saves the King (written by Otto Binder)
name: In the Realm of the Subconscious

description:
1. Roy Rogers on the Apache Trail.

Also includes photos of Roy and Trigger
name: Roy Rogers Comics

description: As the first issue of this three issue mini, this begins a story that tells us of how the young Chastity Marks becomes not only a vampire, but so much more, a weapon to slay the vampires.
name: Act 1 (of 3)

description:
Overview

Marshal Law investigates the mysterious death of Luminous Lad during his indoctrination to the youthful League of Heroes, and you had better believe those spandex punks are quaking with fear and loathing!

Teamed with the Secret Tribunal, comics' toughest hero-hunter goes face-to-face with an otherworldly threat from beyond the stars. Be here when the good Marshal handles first contact the old fashioned way -- with guns blazing! And we mean big, BIG guns!
name: Cape Fear

description:
Overview

It's alien-fragging time for Marshal Law! The teenaged League of Heroes is being decimated by a horde of alien incubi, and it's up to Marshal Law to save them. But can this hero-hating harbinger of fear and loathing function teamed up with the hyper-eager super-team, The Secret Tribunal?

And if slaughtering aliens (and defending snot-nosed super-teens) weren't enough, Marshal Law must fend off the romantic advances of Breathless, the Marilyn Monroe-esque heroine who recharges her powers with sex! But even worse for San Futuro's hero-loathing lawman is when Growing Boy asks him the dreaded question -- "May I be your boy companion?"
name: Court Marshal

volume.name: Crime and Punishment: Marshal Law Takes Manhattan
Marshal Law: Kingdom of the Blind

description:
Overview

When you last saw Marshal Law, he had just put a gun to his head and pulled the trigger. Is that the end of the story? Not by a long shot! Creators Pat Mills and Kevin O'Neill are at Dark Horse now, and they're prepared to bring you more of the tender, moving stories you've come to expect from Marshal Law! Will Marshall Law and his dead girlfriend find happiness at last? Or will she prefer the Black Scarab, who brought the Golden Age Heroes back to life? The "City of Zombies" is classic romance as the living and the dead desperately try to find true love--if only they can keep the flies off long enough!
name: City of Zombies

description:
Now available in trade paperback, this graphic-story album--a prose novella with twenty-five full-page painted illustrations--concludes the sweeping trilogy based on characters and events introduced in the popular Dark Forces interactive games. Jedi Knight chronicles the adventures of Rebel agent Kyle Katarn as he seeks to prevent the legendary Valley of the Jedi from falling into the hands of the Empire's Jerec, a Dark Jedi who plans to harness the unbelievable power of the Valley for his own ends.

Final story in the Dark Forces series. Kyle Katarn learns of his fathers past as a Jedi Knight and begins his training in the force, leading to a confrontation with 7 Dark Jedi.
name: Jedi Knight

volume.name: Star Wars: Dark Forces - Jedi Knight

description:
Ontiir faces the courts for his crimes but manages to escape, even with three Legionnaires attending the trial. The three Legion members, Supergirl, Sun Boy and Brainiac 5, chase after Ontiir while Jacques Foccart, the newest Invisible Kid, tries to deal with the fact that the original Invisible Kid, Lyle Norg, has seeminly returned from the dead and may want to become a Legion of Super-Heroes member again.

Story 2: A Witch May Be Born

Blok learns about the origin of the White Witch.
name: The Trial Of Ontiir

volume.name: Tales of the Legion of Super-Heroes

description: With 3-D glasses and booklet
name: The Tale of Azula

description:
The new Avengers take on the original Avengers! It’s a time-travel battle for the ages that involves two teams of the Earth’s Mightiest Heroes. And what part does Dr. Doom play in this battle of the Avengers?

Fantastic Story of the New Avengers going back in time to battle the original line-up, courtesy of the Scarlet Centurion!

See through Cap's eyes the original Avengers crushing all the heroes and villains who oppose them for world domination!

Great Fight scenes, and guest-stars galore!

Plus a wacky bonus "Avenjerks Assemble" behind the scenes at Marvel!
name: And Time, The Rushing River...!

description: The Dragon mysteriously finds himself in San Futuro in the year 2022, where he is attacked by the mischevious Gangreene, who believe him to be "The Commandment Killer," a serial murderer that has killed Mako, Star III, Justice, and other locals. With the aid of SFPD officer Marshal Law, The Dragon heads off in search of the real killer.

A gorilla at the City Zoo holds up a chalk slate on which is written, "Please believe me! I am the victim of a terrible scientific experiment!"!

The ape pleads with the crowd that he is not just a talking ape, but in fact a scientist named Ralph Gains who has had his brain trapped inside the body of a gorilla. Finally, the gorilla convinces Ralph's sister, Ruth that he is really who he says. But all is not what it seems...
name: "Incredible Story of an Ape with a Human Brain"

description: For what cosmic reason does Thanos seek a confrontation with the planet-devourer Galactus? And must Adam Warlock oppose him, or aid him?
name: Rebellion!

description: Zam Wesell is everything you'd want in a girl: beauty, intelligence, style, the ability to strip and assemble an EE-3 blaster rifle in less than six seconds… She really does have it all. It's no wonder that she has caught the eye of fellow bounty hunter, Jango Fett. Jango is going to need her help in finding and destroying a powerful artifact that could prove to be very destructive if it fell into the wrong hands. Though he isn't usually this sentimental, he wants to make sure the galaxy is safe for his young son. However, Zam's motivations are not so noble. She plans to sell the artifact to the highest bidder. If they can't trust each other and they've got every bounty hunter and cutthroat in the galaxy gunning for them, who can they trust?
Thanos attacks Galactus in the only reasonable way possible, a psychic assault. Guest-starring Moondragon.
name: Alone!

description: Galactus sends his Punishers after Thanos & Warlock. The battle between the cosmic titans gets serious.
name: Hunger!

description:
Dragon and Law are attacked by The Commandment Killer, who now wears the Overlord armor. The Killer gets away and murders sevreral more costumed heroes before Law and The Dragon follow his trail and prevent him from killing Law's nemesis, Suicida. After the Commandment Killer - who is revealed to be Sorry The Nearly Man, a "superhero wannabe" who curates a superhero museum - is defeated and brought to justice, The Dragon mysteriously vanishes once again.

A serial killer who has taken over the mantle of Savage Dragon's arch-enemy Overlord continues to murder former costumed heroes, leaving pseudo-religious notes as to why each hero needed to die.  Soon Mighty Man is counted among the dead leaving Dragon and Marshal Law with a sense of urgency to take down the killer.

Page FEATURES

4 THE HEADQUARTERS

The Men of M.A.C., we're here, we're heterosexual, get used to it...

7 KODIAK

If Men's Adventure has a name, it's KODIAK, Karl Kodiak. Spanning the 20th Century, it's our biggest story ever, with art by... Glen Fabry, Trevor Von Eeden, Dave Elliot, Tony Salmons, Bob Wiacek, Cary Polkovitz, Terry Austin, Simon Bisley, Jerry Paris, Kevin Maguire, Karl Story, Rick Mays, Cully Hamner and colored by Arthur Suydam (Whew!) 

46 ACTION FIGURES EPISODE 3: FRANKENSTEIN'S BACHELOR PARTY

They're dangerous and pretty, they come from the big city, one's got tape on her titties... the Action Figures Girls... Art By Kevin Maguire & Arthur Suydam 

60 PIRATE HEARTS EPISODE 2: OLD HICKORY

While Hollywood slackers are still trying to come out with an all-girl pirate film, your M.A.C. Buddies are already in print! It's lusty ladies on the high seas and two fisted action ashore! Arrrr, Maties! Art by Russ Heath

72 MISS ADVENTURE EPISODE 2: THE FEM-B.I. 

When Camille tries to follow in her father's footsteps, she goes "head to head" with the Female Bureau of Investigation! Art by Cary Polkovitz & Terry Austin

82 SPECIAL BONUS MISS ADVENTURE EPISODE 3: MISS-TAKEN IDENTITY 

"Three Queens... It's like the theme from F-Troop, I can't get it out of me head..." Art by Polkovitz and Austin

93 COVER ART 

"Kodiak" by Azpiri 

96 NEXT ISSUE PREVIEW 

You're all invited back next time to this local address, to have a heaping helping of our damsels in distress!

FEATURES:

4 THE HEADQUARTERS

A fare thee well to an absent friend.

6 MISS ADVENTURE

EPISODE 4: "MUTANT CUFFS"

All right, so our heroes fight a bunch of Demon Ninjas and then a Cyborg-Killer-From-The-Future appears to mindblast them all and they end up in mutant cuffs... but this time... it's personal. Art by Polkovitz and Austin

21 SALEM

EPISODE 2:"NOBODY KNOWS BUT ME"

The First Lady haunted by the spirits of all those she murdered... who'd have figured?! Art by Doug Gregory

33 SLIM & NUN

EPISODE 4: "MICK THE QUICK" Slim meets a lady Mountie and Joan has dinner with a gunslinger. Art by Dan Barry

44 HERICANE

EPISODE 3: "THE LUCKIEST GUY IN THE WORLD!"

This is Tim Bowie. Tim is Emily's new boyfriend. How much woman can one man take? Be afraid, Tim, be very afraid... Art by Kevin Maguire & Karl Story

71 LA-X

EPISODE 3: "THE SEX FILES"

The truth is out there... trust no one... oh, what's the point of looking for UFO's when all I can think about is Agent Elke's creamy thighs? Art by Les Edwards

77 ACTION FIGURES

EPISODE 4: "BAD GIRLS"

What you gonna do? What you gonna do when they come for you? Guest starring the all new Bad Girl & Wild Woman. Art by Jason Pearson & Karl Story

90 PAPER DOLLS

Action Figures Part II Art by Yiernet Mot

96 NEXT ISSUE

Looky what we got for you next time...
name: HERICANE

description:
Table of Contents

COVER ART

80 "MISS ADVENTURE" Art by Gary Leach

FEATURES

4 HEADQUARTERS

We're still shuckin` an' jivin' here at Adventure Central!

6 SLIM & NUN

EPISODE 6: "MICK THE QUICK: PART 2" We've seen his colorful post, now meet the most deadly female of all ... Art by Dan Barry

20 DICK WILLING, PRIVATE DICK

Tougher than Bogart, harder than Robinson, longer than Holmes... Willing, Dick Willing, P. I. Art by Keith Giffen

25 MISS ADVENTURE

EPISODE 6:"PRESSING ENGAGEMENTS" Jeez! Will'ya look at that... and you know those phone calls you just hate to get... Art by Cary Polkovitz and a cast of thousands

43 PIRATE HEARTS

EPISODE 3: "LESBIAN PIRATES" How do you hide on a boat full of pirates? Especially if you're a fresh young thing? Art by Russ Heath

56 KODIAK

EPISODE 3: "DADDY'S LITTLE GIRL: PART 2" This "can't be hurt" thing sure can have its drawbacks! Art by Steve Dillon & Rick Bryant

82 BLACK ROGUE

EPISODE 2: "THE ROGUE RIDES AGAIN" A tighter bodkin and a new look for Petruchio as he rights wrongs, medieval style. Art by Gray Morrow

92 DINKY

With a name like Dinky, can rollicking entertainment be far away? Art by Cary Polkovitz

96 NEXT ISSUE

We have so much good shit, we felt we must share...
name: It Went Off In My Hand! / Miss Adventure

description:
Table of Contents:

COVER ART

5 THE KRAKEN'S WAKE. Art by Alan Davis & Mark Farmer

FEATURES;

4 KRAKEN'S WAKE

First Contact: The setting is deep space. After hundreds of years of exploration, Man is alone. But now, no more... Art by Davis & Farmer. Story by: Caragonne, Collins, & Davis

23 ACTION FIGURES

Rough Justice: Love is blind... and there's no such thing as justice; ask any taxpayer... you'll see what we mean... By Jason Pearson

38 BLACK ROGUE

The Prince: Kick me, Kate. Renaissance silliness with a classic costume well before its time... Art by Gray Morrow. Story by Buzz Dixon

50 HERICANE

Old Flames: A mysterious trans-dimensional message haunts Camille and beau Tim... can an action playset be far behind? Art by Maguire & Story. Story by Vallely & Brown

64 PRIVATE HEARTS

Skullduggery: Mundaca, back from the dead and thirsting for revenge - what form could that take from a gaily festooned pirate? Art by Russ Heath. Story by Jan Strnad
name: The Kraken's Wake

description: Gilbert Hernandez returns to that funky little Central American hamlet of his with another story set in the "Sopa de Gran Pena" days starring "The Children of Palomar" — in this case the obnoxious and picked-on Gato (whom LR fans will remember as Pipo's husband-to-be), Soledad, Guero, Pintor, and Arturo. The quintet of troublemakers' explorations across a bottomless chasm results in two of the kids coming face to face with... well, we won't spoil the surprise. But Sheriff Chelo is on the case and saves the day! With the very earliest Palomar stories recently released in a redesigned and affordable format in the Heartbreak Soup volume, these new stories of Palomar come along at the perfect time, and the superswanky Ignatz format provides Beto with a perfect canvas.

The third and last installment of New Tales of Old Palomar, in which Gilbert Hernandez returns to some of his best-loved characters, focuses on the gorgeous but troubled Tonantzín. Everybody in Palomar seems to take the supernatural with a grain of salt, but young Tonantzín is determined to uncover the mystery of the laughing baby that only appears to her, haunting her daily life. What is the baby's link to the giant stone idols that stand outside the small town...?

Beto revisits Old Palomar with brand new tales of his favorite characters.

As a medieval mercenary, Ezra is always for hire... for the right price. She has accepted a job from a deadly band of thieves led by Barak Bacillus. But before her quest has even begun, she finds herself shackled and held captive on a brigand's ship. She'll need more than her good looks to stay alive...

Sif has taken the bait and become one with the Destroyer! It’s a disaster all around, as Balder remains under the spell of Karnilla, while Thor does battle against Sif…unknowingly!

-- To Rise Again! - (Lee/Kirby) Odin returns Thor's Powers to him just in the nick of time as he battles the Destroyer - but little does he know, trapped in the body of the Destroyer is the mind and soul of his beloved Sif; no matter who wins, they both lose!

Inhuman At Large! - (Lee/Kirby) Captured at sea, Triton is taken back to civilization to be put on display - but the aquatic Inhuman has other ideas!
name: To Rise Again

description:
Balder’s battle with the Rock Trolls rages on! Odin pays a visit to Midgard...

The Dilemma of Dr. Blake! - (Lee/Kirby) On Earth the final showdown between Thor and the Destroyer commences, while in the Norn Queen's realm, Balder must battle Ulik!

"While the City Shrieks!" - (Lee/Kirby) Triton tries to make contact with humanity, a move which proves disastrous.
name: The Dilemma of Dr. Blake!

description:
Someone has stolen the Thunder God’s hammer! Mysteries abound, as the mighty Thor must track down the thief of the mightier Mjolnir! Plus, Lady Sif incurs an injury.

Loki steals Mjolnir from Thor, turning him back into Donald Blake!
name: But Dr. Blake Can Die

description:
Thor nearly has Loki in the palm of defeat, until Odin shows up! What is this new threat against Asgard Odin speaks of? And will the God of Thunder allow Loki to escape his grasp yet again? Guest-starring Karnilla the Norn Queen!

Ulik unleashes the MANGOG while Thor is away on Earth!
name: ...To Wake The Mangog!

description:
Mangog continues to storm Asgard to as his plot of revenge thickens. Could this be the coming of Ragnarok as Odin predicted? Thor fights against Asgard’s End of Days, but the battle may well be out of his hands!

Thor Battles the Mangog!
name: Now Ends the Universe

description:
Balder finds himself in deep trouble after rejecting the love of Karnilla Queen of Norn. “Hell hath no fury like”…you know the rest. Thor goes into battle with Mangog, the demonic creature intent on bringing Ragnarok to Asgard. When the God of Thunder is joined by the Warriors Three, will the scales of victory at last be tipped in Asgard’s favor?

Thor continues his long battle against the Mangog!
name: The Hammer and the Holocaust!

description:
Balder the Brave, Warrior Prince of Asgard, versus the mighty Mangog! Will an entire army of Asgardian soldiers be enough to thwart the coming of Ragnarok? Find out in the explosive conclusion to Mangog’s siege of Asgard.

Odin awakens in time to end the epic battle between Thor and the Mangog!
name: Behind Him...Ragnarok!

description:
Thor returns to Earth under the guise of Donald Blake. Contemplative after his battle with Mangog, Thor reflects on his dual life as mortal and god. Who is Thor? Is he Donald Blake, a mortal granted divine powers? Or a true God of Thunder, the son of Odin?

Thor's origin is recounted from Journey into Mystery #83, along with a few pages of new material.
name: The Way It Was!

description:
The mystery of Donald Blake revealed! After seeking answers from Odin about his true identity, Donald Blake gets more than he bargained for. Is Doctor Blake the true Odinson? And if so, how did Thor become trapped in the body of a mortal man?

Odin recounts the origin of Thor.
name: The Answer At Last!

description:
Young Captain Adventure (Episode 1: Hotblooded)

Young Captain Adventure attempts to live up to the legacy of his father (the second Captain Adventure and co-founder of the Team Supreme) by heading out to New York City to sign up with Team Supreme. However, he learns the team is now all about the publicity and after an argument with Hotblood he decides to prove that he can be a true hero while they can't and he meets Darkblood -a super villain- for a fight. Sadly, he doesn't prove himself at all and after getting beaten by Darkblood's henchmen he gets beaten up by Hericane (a member of Team Supreme whom he first met by accidentally walking into her and burying his face in her cleavage)...but not everything is lost as Hericane decides she fancies Young Captain Adventure and lets him choose top or bottom. Afraid and confused he chooses top and superhero sex ensues, laying waste to the area of the city...but at least Young Captain Adventure got some good out of the whole experience.

Scion (Episode 1: The Hunter)

It is 1994, the KGB has forcibly been dissolved and in Moscow, things are not how they used to be, but one secret government project has not yet been spilled, Scion. A man is sent out to locate the fifty original test subjects that make up Scion. His first target leads him to a household where he interrogates the mother and father as to the whereabouts of their nineteen year old daughter. Though at first they are unwilling to submit they eventually relent and admit that she ran away sometime ago and became nothing more than a prostitute. So the hunter leaves their house and walking down the street he picks up a dropped 100 dollar bill and hands it to a woman. He then continues to seek out his prey, he infiltrates her quarters after watching one of her sessions with binoculars and coercing the satisfied man to leave with his gun he then makes love to her after paying her with a 100 dollar bill. Suddenly she begins to change, to transform into some metahuman creation and when she inquires to what is going on the hunter replies, while changing shape, that she knows everything because she is the first one of their kind, she killed the hunter, and now...together they are Scion.

Libby in the Lost World

This tale was meant to be that one story that women could "identify with" while men could still enjoy, how women can identify with it is a question you can ponder...the story opens in a plane where a woman named Libby has decided it was finally time to get married, the man was a slob and a pimple on mankind but he was rich, and that's what she wanted. However the plane goes down when it crashes into something and when she awakes she finds dinosaurs devouring her husband-to-be. She runs for her life to escape the reptile and in the process loses most of her clothing. That's when she stumbles across the "cavemen" who seem rather enthused to have at what may be the first woman they've seen in years but she overcomes them and pushes them back for she is modern woman! The story concludes when she kills a dinosaur that was attacking her and the men begin to worship her as a goddess, and she decides to take her mother's advice and ends up with a doctor...a witch doctor of course.

Bethlehem Steele (Episode 1: Pirate Hearts)

It's the 23rd century and in a spaceship two women (Beth and Thea) are making love to each other when suddenly their ship collides with something. It's not long before their ship is boarded by pirates and although Beth makes a grand stand against them, they manage to subdue her and Thea and take them to Captain Gemini. After talking with them he eventually decides that they can be part of his crew, they accept his offer and Bethlehem (the mystery woman) now works for him. Some days later, Bethlehem and the Captain are together in a club for those people some might consider "outcasts" and while they're there Bethlehem fights to defend her Captain from an angry Captain Krush who was cheated by Gemini. This leads to her getting impaled and then running away into an alley where we see her suddenly without a scratch. Gemini runs to her to see if she's okay and she says it was nothing, they then proceed to have sex right there in the alley (the crew-members watch and make their comments for a short time) but eventually Beth does go to the medic (Thea) and it is revealed she is in fact a cyborg.

Doctor Dare (Episode 1: The Right Man for the Job)

It's World War II, and America has a new scientist amongst their crew, a public video portrays her as something of a mere housewife, breaching the gender barrier to help the U.S. army in the scientific area, though her contribution doesn't appear to be too important. However, that is exactly the military's ploy, to paint Dr. Joanna Dare as a timid female that should be of no threat and couldn't possibly be working on anything of extreme importance. Quite the contrary to that, she is working on a Super Soldier Formula of sorts but it's still in the testing stage. While she's working on it though, Agent D and her Nazi henchmen bust into the lab and tear through Dr. Dare's files, taking what they want and leaving Dare tied to a chair with the building on fire and a bomb ticking to detonation. In this crisis situation she decides she has to drink the formula sitting on the counter and does so by craning her neck over to the counter and picking the beaker up with her mouth and tipping her head back to ingest the liquid. Then the bomb explodes and all goes black but months later the Dr. awakes to learn all her wounds had healed on their own and that she seems superhuman. She seems to learn that giving into her new sexual urges increases her power and uses this to defeat a returning Agent D one more time...but not before her lover, Dr. William Regis is killed and as he dies in her arms he lets her know that she must not let the formula fall into the wrong hands and she must fight for America.

Hotblood vs. The Diablo Bros.

The story opens in the home of the Diablo Brothers (Ice Cream and Ice Coffee) who are pissed off at how Mr. Antonacchi is cheating them with his WWE-like events that utilize superhumans rather then regular run-of-the-mill humans but just like wrestling, it's all staged and broadcast on Pay-Per-View. As it turns out, Ice Cream and Ice Coffee are tired of being humiliated and defeated by Hotblood so they throw out the script. Meanwhile, Mr. Antonacchi preps Hotblood for the fight through publicity and does his best to keep the man away from women and food to keep him in his best shape. However, Hotblood is very unhappy with this arrangement and finds it hard to control himself...so finally, when the staged fight begins between Hotblood and the Diablo Brothers, they start kicking his ass until they wind up sending him flying through a window where he ends up in the restaurant where the two girls who want him work. Needless to say, he ends up eating and fornicating in a rather disturbing event that could ruin his career but he doesn't care. So Mr. Antonacchi lies so that the Diablo Brothers will stop Hotblood from ruining his career but Hotblood is upset that his intercourse was interrupted and completely destroys the Diablo Brothers, successfully making his greatest fight to date! And so with his victory he enjoys the high life of money, food and babes while Mr. Antonacchi takes care of the rest.

Right Place, Wrong Time

This is just a short story at the back of the issue as part of Penthouse Comix International, which is meant to display the artistic talents of non-American artists, in this case Horacio Altuna. The story is about a young man and woman and their "forbidden love". Since both of them still live with their parents they must have their sexual intercourse, elsewhere, usually in the oddest of places such as picture booths and other hidden but public areas. And when they finally have enough money to get a home of their own and marry one another, they realize the sex just isn't as fun in the safety of their own home and they go back to living the good life of adrenaline-pumping sex.
name: One

description:
Cover Date: 1 - Sep-1997

Michael Lopez cover; Sweet Chastity reprints begin; Last magazine size

Sweet Chastity; The Lost World of Dinosaur Sex; Hot Heels: Diary of a Road-Babe

Writers: Bob Guccione, Eva Morris

Artists: Ron Embleton, Alphonzo Aspiri, Luis Royo, Milo Manara, Horatio Altuna, Julie Bell, Boris Vallejo, Michael Lopez
name: SWEET CHASTITY

description: In the first issue, a missing friend leads Koni to Prince Hopohopo who is using human sacrifices to raise Puea the God of Darkness in the form of a living Tiki statue.

As an Elysian war rages onward and spills upon the Earth, an ethereal gift is all that stands between the dark minions of Hell and their malignant conquest of the Heavens. An unlikely protagonist, Suzanne Bancroft is a single nurse at a small Colorado hospital who only wants to live a safe and sheltered life. However she has been chosen to hold the key to both heaven and hell in the palm of her trembling unsure hands.

volume.name: Arcana Studio Presents: Free Comic Book Day

description:
1. The Spy (a Hostess Fruit Pie ad starring Batman / pencils by Curt Swan, inks by Vince Colletta)

  2. Batman's Greatest Failure!

"Yes Batman-- I'm a murderer! And here comes my weapon! Kill him Brutus!"
name: Batman's Greatest Failure!

description: While the team takes a much-needed break, Legionnaires M'Onel and Apparition recall a time they both served in another Legion ? the intergalactic law enforcement organization known as L.E.G.I.O.N., to be exact. Travel back to the 20th Century as LE.G.I.O.N. officers Valor and Phase encounter a race with a definitive solution to the problem of poverty!
name: Eat the Poor

description: Part 1 of a 2-part story that finds the Legion Outpost under attack from the Fatal Four (plus one). The entire Legion would have a tough time against this deadly bunch, so imagine how bad the odds are with only Brainy and Gates on board the Outpost?
name: The Fatal Four... Plus One!

description: Concluding a 2-part story that finds the Legion Outpost under attack from the Fatal Five, now featuring a deadly and unexpected fifth member! With the other Legionnaires on vacation or patrolling the galaxy, and Brainiac 5.1 and Gates in the clutches of the bad guy, it seems the Fatal Five just may win!
name: End Of The Line

description:
1. "I... Amalgamax" (Superman and Batman) written by Cary Burkett, penciled and inked by George Tuska, colored by Gene D'Angelo and lettered by Adam Kubert.
  2. "When the Old ...Clock Died!" (Green Arrow) written by Mike W. Barr, penciled and inked by Dan Spiegle, colored by Tom Ziuko and lettered by Adam Kubert.

Notes:

  • The cover contains an advertisement on the billboard for the series Night Force.
  • Last multi-story issue.
  • Superman Museum in a cameo flashback.
  • Arrow-Line Arrow and Boxing Glove Arrow used.
  • The last Green Arrow feature in World's Finest Comics. The Green Arrow series continues in Detective Comics #521.
name: I... Amalgamax / When the Old ...Clock Died!

description:
"Extra : presenting all new Popeye comics, especially written and drawn for this book"

  1. Get out of my restaurant...

  2. Outdoor Boy, or, Please Let Me In the House!

  3. Big Blow,or, A Big Wind Is Just a Breeze If Ya Ain't Got a Mast Fer Yer Sail!

  4. No, Wimpy!

  5. Popeye, I bought Swee'Pea a new...
name: Popeye

description:
Story 1: Meanwhile...

Cosmic Boy and the Legion of Substitute Heroes foil a robbery attempt but are trapped on a runaway space craft. Jacques Foccart and Lyle Norg, the two Invisible Kids, decide to figure out the mystery of Lyle's return. Meanwhile, Wildfire finds himself going out of control and simply vanishes in front of his fellow Legionnaires.

Story 2: The Path Not Taken

The White Witch continues to tell her origin to Blok.
name: Meanwhile...

volume.name: Tales of the Legion of Super-Heroes

description:
Shaggy and Scooby find the field of their dreams…er, make that nightmares! Plus, it's true, monkeys make everything better!

Ape Misbehavin'

Mystery Inc goes to Hollywood and visit the set of a movie. When the beautiful starlet is kidnapped by a Ghostly Gorilla, it's up them to get to the bottom of things

Home Run Haunting

The gang go out for some peanuts and crackerjacks when the owner calls them to solve the mystery of the ghost haunting the stadium. The bases are loaded as the strike out another ghoul.

Ice Creaming Mimi

Going out for ice cream turns out to be a chilling experience when an ancestor of the shop comes for dinner.
name: Ape Misbehavin';  Home Run Haunting;  Ice Creaming Mimi

description: The end of Apollyon

Kade, the gothic demon hunter, has just awoken from a fifty-year coma and is now being guided through India by the beautiful Priya. He's on the hunt for his first Fallen, but what he finds will shock him to his soul!

1. Spree For All (Bart Simpson / written by Evan Dorkin : reprinted from: Bart Simpson #31)

  2. Fry's Top 10 Reasons Why Robots Make Great Roommates (starring Fry & Bender from Futurama / written by Eric Rogers)

  3. Familiarity Breeds Farklept! (Futurama / written by Eric Rogers)

  4. The Secret Life Of Bart Simpson (starring Bart / written by Tom Peyer : reprinted from: Bart Simpson #30)

  5. Captain's Log (starring Zapp Brannigan)

"Ad" for Zapp Brannigan's Captain's Log candy bar! Will Leela buy any?

  1. Hot Tied (starring Ralph Wiggum and Chief Wiggum / written by Amanda McCann)
name: Free-For-All! 2007

description:
Weisshaupt gets a heart attack before he can destroy Cerebus. Cerebus hits the big white glowing thingy, and starts sneezing flames. Cerebus tries to use the thingy against Mrs Gutch, but it doesn't work as planned, so she beats him up. Cerebus gets a telepathic message from the Regency Elf, detailing a secret route to the Regency Hotel.

Also includes: "The Jade Princess" pt. 2 (a Dick Mallet adventure / by Michael Cherkas), and a sketch of young Cerebus and Squinteye.
name: Ignore It, It's Just Another Reality

character_credits.name: Big Round Glowing White Strange Thing

first_appearance_characters.name: Big Round Glowing White Strange Thing

description: Has a Duck Dodgers strip

1. Cover by Bob Oksner.
  2. "The Hunters" written by Cary Bates, penciled by John Rosenberger and inked by Vince Colletta. (Lois Lane, Superman vs. The 100) The Hunters division of the 100 makes Superman think Lois is a jungle woman.
  3. "Murder by Motor" written by Cary Bates, penciled by Don Heck and inked by Henry Scarpelli. (Rose and Thorn)

"Lois Lane! Prove you are our queen... kill him!"
name: The Hunters / Murder by Motor

description:
Story 1: Judgement!

The Legion finally track down Ontiir, who is a double agent between the Dark Circle and the Science Police. He dies in battle and Supergirl wonders if she belongs in the future, flying into the past through the Time Barrier.

Story 2: The Forging

The origin of the White Witch is continued.
name: Judgment!

volume.name: Tales of the Legion of Super-Heroes

description:
"Batman is dead! And it's all because of you, Superman!"

  1. The Ghost of Batman (Superman, Batman and Robin vs Sphinx Gang / written by Dave Wood) While Superman is disguised as Batman, it seems like the Sphinx Gang assassinates him! How can they reveal that Batman is actually alive without giving away his identity?

  2. Special Christmas Quiz - Christmas in Many Lands! (public service message / written by Jack Schiff)

  3. Ollie (gag strip by Henry Boltinoff)

  4. The Amazing Money Bombs (full text story)

  5. The Doom Hunters (Aquaman, Aqualad / written by Jack Miller : reprinted in: Teen Titans (1966 series) #35). Aquaman gets involved with the Daredevil’s Club , when member Tom Blake barely escapes an assassination attempt. Investigation reveals the man who orchestrated it, Wally Welky . Wally was the president of the club and cousin to Blake. They were both candidates for a great inheritance and Welky wanted to eliminate the competition. (Tom Blake happens to also be the civilian identity of Catman).
name: The Ghost of Batman ; The Doom Hunters

description: Kade is the gothic demon hunter who doesn't feel, but always hurts. As a Child of the Black Sun, Kade is the ageless balance that tips the dark scale back towards the light, as he hunts the demons and The Fallen. Kade and Ezra have been hunting demons for nearly a thousand years, and another Black Sun is on the horizon. With it comes one of the most powerful enemies known to man.

1. Cover by Terry Shoemaker and Karl Kesel.
  2. "Death Trip!" plotted by Paul Levitz and Keith Giffen, dialogue by Mindy Newell, penciled by Terry Shoemaker, inked by Karl Kesel, colored by Carl Gafford and lettered by Ben Oda.
  3. "Driveforce!" written by Robert Loren Fleming, penciled by Denys Cowan, inked by Sal Trapani, colored by Joe Orlando, lettered by Gasper and edited by Andy Helfer.
  4. "Once a Hero..." plotted by Paul Levitz, dialogue by Mindy Newell, penciled by George Tuska, inked by Karl Kesel, colored by Carl Gafford and lettered by Ben Oda.

Story 1: "Death Trip!"

Jacques Foccart and Wildfire find themselves in the same dimension where they found the seemingly alive Lyle Norg, the first Invisible Kid. They learn that Lyle Norg isn't real and actually a malevolent being intent on destroying Jacques Foccart and Wildfire. They are able to escape that dimension, though. Meanwhile, Duo Damsel reveals her resentment of Brainiac 5's decision of recreating a new model of Computo, the computer that originally killed one of Triplicate Girl's forms.

Story 2: "Once a Hero..."

A tale of the Heroes of Lallor.
name: Death Trip! / Once a Hero...

volume.name: Tales of the Legion of Super-Heroes

description: The Legion debates over admitting new members on the team during their meeting. Mon-El and Shadow Lass go to Shadow Lass' home planet of Talok VIII to check on her cousin, Grev. They arrive to find a faction on her planet led by Lady Memory, a woman who wants to revert their society to the old ways. Mon-El and Shadow Lass are able to quell the army and are soon met by Lady Memory and the Persuader, whom she has paid to help her in her endeavor. They have captured Grev and Lady Memory is able to stop Mon-El from saving him. She induces memories causing pain for Mon-El, so he rushes off into space, going a bit insane. Meanwhile, Brainiac 5 tries to augment Dawnstar's tracking abilities with his science.
name: Shadows Of The Future Past

volume.name: Tales of the Legion of Super-Heroes

description:
1. Cover by Curt Swan and Stan Kaye.
  2. "Superboy's First Day at School!" written by Otto Binder, penciled and inked by George Papp. (Superboy, Lana Lang, Ma and Pa Kent) Reprinted in: Superman Annual #8. This "Untold Tale of Superboy" shows Superboy at his first day of school. Will Superboy's using of his super-powers give him away?
  3. "Water: A Good Friend or Deadly Enemy - Depending on You!" (public service message / written by Jack Schiff)
  4. "Peg" gag strip by Henry Boltinoff.
  5. "How Krypto Made History!" written by Otto Binder, penciled and inked by George Papp. (Krypto, Superboy, various historical figures) Reprinted in: Adventure Comics #323. Krypto finds a dinosaur bone, but it tastes a bit stale, so he goes back in time to find a fresher one. When he does, he inadvertantly helps historical figures do things, like help Arthur pull the sword out of the stone. Why doesn't Superboy let him eat any of the bones when Krypto arrives at the dinosaur age?
  6. "Chief Hot Foot" gag strip by Henry Boltinoff.
  7. "The Punishment of Superboy!" written by Otto Binder, penciled and inked by John Sikela. (Superboy, Ma and Pa Kent, Superboy robots) Reprinted in: Superman Annual #7. After ineffectively trying normal ways to punish Superboy, will Ma and Pa's leaving teach him? An "Untold Tale of Superboy."
name: Superboy's First Day at School! / How Krypto Made History! / The Punishment of Superboy!

description:
This 23 page preview book from Wizard Magazine introduces our heroine and gives a little insight into who she is. She sits in her fully formed Endless Graveyard the queen of all that is dead and dying she muses on lucifer, her curse, her father, her mother.

She finds a church built in her land and enters to find Niccolo playing wit the Nexus of All Things. A gateway that can connect to anywhere. He is mad with the power of it and uses the power to take her sword, restrain her to the wall and demand Lucifer's power from her. She breaks free and Niccolo shows her that he Mother is the anchor for the Nexus a good person to balance out with th evil of this place.

Incensed Lady Death makes his heart explode in his chest. She releases her mother and tells her to goto heaven gate and that she cannot follow.

Following the main comic there is a:

  • 4 page interview about the creation of Lady Death .
  • 4 pages of designing Lady Death and the comic itself with sketches.
name: Wizard 1/2

description:
Ralph Kiner

Not since the immortal Babe Ruth flashed across the U.S. sports scene, has anye one individual so completely captivated the fans! Exploding homerun power in every direction since he reache the big leagues in 1946--Ralph Kiner is baseball's biggest hero...

This year, the experts believe he will break the record of 60 in a season set by the Babe in 1927...

Here is the story of a sandlot kid who is becoming a part of baseball legend before our very eyes...

Ezzard Charles

Scorned by the skeptics, unrecognized by the boxing commissions of New York State, the British Empire, and several nations, Ezzard Charles was a champion without a world's title, a king without a real throne... until one night last September at Yankee Stadium! Then he stood toe to toe with the greatest fighting machine of the last 15 years, the Brown Bomber, and destroyed the myth of his invincibility! He shattered the idol of the American people, and his own boyhood hero, but Ezzard Charles won full claim to the title: Heavyweight Champion of the World!

Killer In the Ring (Text Only Story)

The Phil Rizzutto Story!

The American league's most valuable player in 1950... the sensational shortstop of the world's champion New York Yankee whose baseball career was almost nipped in the bud his first time away from home... here is the little-known inside story of the mighty mite who wouldn't let anything stop him from proving he was a star! He was chased off the tryout fields of two major league clubs for being too small to be a ballplayer, and went on to mean sudden death to opposing teams!

The Story of…Warren Spahn

Daily trips to the woodshed led to diamond fame for Warren Spahn, the stylish southpaw of the Boston Braves! Today they call him the best "control" pitcher in baseball! And it all dates back to those afterschool sessions with a patient father...
name: Ralph Kiner

description:
A mysterious villain has captured Liberty Belle, and Hourman has just 60 minutes to traverse the dark underworld of the DCU to find her!

Hourman's wife Liberty Belle is kidnapped by the new Time Commander. After following Liberty Belle's signal to a abandoned building, Hourman is ambushed by the Time Commander and taken to his layer. Hourman later finds out that the Time Commanders lair is between time where Hourman's powers do not work because they are time released.
name: 60 Minutes

description:
Features Include:
No Escape!
The Man Who Failed!
Swing, Busher!
Yesterday's Hero
The Killer!
name: No Escape!
